tit.cmt: 同ファイル中にもう一人の「しきのみこ（志貴皇子）」が登場するため、漢字の併記が必要と思われます。

sen.j: 磯城皇子（しきのみこ、7世紀後半頃)は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Shiki no miko (around the latter half of the seventh century) was a member of the imperial family who lived in the Asuka period.
Shiki no miko (around the latter half of the seventh century) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Shiki no miko (around the latter half of the seventh century) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 父は天武天皇、母は宍人臣大麻呂の女。
sen.e: His father was the Emperor Tenmu, and his mother was a daughter of Shishihito no omi Omaro.
sen.cmt: 宍人臣大麻呂：読みは「ししひとのおみおおまろ」のようです。
sen.e: His father was the Emperor Tenmu, and his mother was a daughter of Shishihito no omi Omaro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His father was the Emperor Tenmu, and his mother was a daughter of Shishihito no omi Omaro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was a younger maternal half-brother of Imperial Prince Osakabe.
He was a younger brother-uterine of the Imperial Prince Osakabe.
sen.cmt: younger maternal half-brother→younger brother-uterine と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: He was a younger brother-uterine of the Imperial Prince Osakabe.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母姉妹に泊瀬部皇女・託基皇女がいる。
sen.e: His maternal half-sisters were Imperial Princess Hasetsube and Imperial Princess Taki.
sen.cmt: 泊瀬部皇女：読みは「はつせべのひめみこ」のようです。
sen.e: His sisters-uterine were the Imperial Princess Hasetsube and the Imperial Princess Taki.
sen.cmt: maternal half-sisters→sisters-uterine と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: His sisters-uterine were the Imperial Princess Hasetsube and the Imperial Princess Taki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 事績に不明な点が多く、686年（朱鳥元年）8月に志貴皇子と共に封200戸を加えられたが、以後の消息は分かっていない。
sen.e: Most of his activities are unknown, and his life after he and Shiki no miko (Prince Shiki [志貴]) were granted 200 households of fuko (residential units [ko] assigned as prebends [fu] to support top-ranking officials, temples, shrines, and royal households such as those of the queen-consort and crown prince) in 686 is unknown.
sen.cmt: （朱鳥元年）8月：西暦686年8月28日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Most of his achievements are unknown, and his life after he and Shiki no miko (the Prince Shiki [志貴]) were granted 200 households of fuko (residential units [ko] assigned as fiefs [fu] to support top-ranking officials, temples, shrines, and royal households such as those of the queen-consort and crown prince) in 686 is unknown.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。activities→achievements,prebends→fiefs と修正しました。
sen.e: Most of his achievements are unknown, and his life after he and Shiki no miko (the Prince Shiki [志貴]) were granted 200 households of fuko (residential units [ko] assigned as fiefs [fu] to support top-ranking officials, temples, shrines, and royal households such as those of the queen-consort and crown prince) in 686 is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 679年（天武8年）の吉野の盟約に参加した諸皇子に名を連ねていないこと、また『新撰姓氏録』に「浄広壱」とあることから、大宝律令成立直前に30歳前後で早世したと推定される。
sen.e: Because he is not included in the princes participated in the Yoshino Pact in 679, and the rank of 'joko ichi' (the first rank of joi yoshina, four rank of joi, which corresponds to Shoshiinoge, Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade in ranks for Shoo and shoshin, vassal of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) appears in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility), it is likely that he had died right before the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) was established, at the age of around 30.
sen.cmt: 吉野の盟約：定訳は不明です。
sen.e: Because he was not included in the princes who participated in the Yoshino Pact in 679, and the rank of 'joko ichi' (the first rank of joi yoshina, four rank of joi, which corresponds to Shoshiinoge, Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade in ranks for Shoo and shoshin, vassal of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code) appears in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility), it is likely that he had died right before the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) was established, at the age of around 30.
sen.cmt: is→was と修正しました。who を補いました。

sen.j: 母親の身分が高くなかったことも関係して、数多くいた天武天皇の皇子の中では影の薄い存在であった。
sen.e: He was not distinguished among many of princes of the Emperor Tenmu, partially due to his mother's relatively low rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was not distinguished among many of princes of the Emperor Tenmu, partially due to his mother's relatively low rank.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、三園氏・笠原氏等の後裔氏族が知られ、また5代孫の坂井王は862年（貞観 (日本)4年）に清春氏を賜姓されて臣籍降下している（一説に865年とも）。
sen.e: However, the Misono and Kasahara clans are his descendant clans, and Prince Sakai, who was his fifth generation descendant, received the surname of Kiyoharu in 862 (some state that the year was 865) and descended to subject status.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: なお、「微過に縁て」皇子の列から除かれたという御方大野の父を磯城皇子と見る説があるが、その根拠は乏しい。
sen.e: One theory has it that Shiki no miko was the father of Mikata no Ono, who was deprived of his royal title 'due to a minor offence,' but the theory lacks substantial evidence.
One theory has it that Shiki no miko was the father of Mikata no Ono, who was deprived of his prince title 'due to a minor offence,' but the theory lacks substantial evidence.
sen.cmt: royal title→prince title と修正しました。
